text: desk sitting is really starting to hurt
our bodies we work for 8 10 12 hours a
day sitting in a desk consistently one
of the worst things is to sit for
prolonged periods because all the
pressure is on your hips and on your low
back and if you talked to a lot of your
friends I bet you'll have some low back
pain so it's really important to stand
up every 30 minutes and the cool thing
about standing up every 30 minutes is
not only do you take the pressure off
your spine but a lot of research is
coming out showing that your metabolism
stays elevated if all you do is stand
once every 30 minutes so if you got that
workout going in the morning and then
you just stand up once every 30 minutes
you're burning calories just by doing
that which I know we all want to do I
think that if you're an office worker
who sits all day at a desk and you end
up in a forward flexed posture
stretching is essential to keep yourself
healthy so something simple as squeezing
your shoulder blades back helps to
stretch out your PEC muscles and then
improve the posture things like chin
tucks taking your chin and pulling it
back helps to bring your ears over your
shoulders and give you good plumb line
posturing and then another exercise I
like to tell people to do is to take
both hands put it in a doorway and just
lean through the doorway it pulls your
shoulders back and it it also improves
your posture those three simple
exercises if you do throughout the day
in addition to standing will help reduce
pain
